title: FAS to resume search for 10th club - local or foreign - to join Singapore Premier League
description: FAS president Bernard Tan said the association would put out a request for proposal in early October and would consider more than one club joining the league if it gets more applicants.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Speaking to reporters at a press conference following the 42nd FAS Congress at Sheraton Towers Singapore on Monday (Sep 16), FAS president Bernard Tan said the association would put out a request for proposal early next month and that both local or foreign clubs can apply.
  • The goal is for the new club to compete in the 2025/26 SPL season.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: FAS to resume search for 10th club - local or foreign - to join Singapore Premier League
#attributes.title: FAS to resume search for 10th club - local or foreign - to join Singapore Premier League

title: 'Japanese Steph Curry' Keisei Tominaga just wants to enjoy basketball – and fulfil his NBA dream
description: Speaking to CNA in an exclusive interview, Tominaga says there's no added pressure to be compared with one of the best shooters in the modern game.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Described by some as the "Japanese Stephen Curry", basketballer Keisei Tominaga is well-known for his ability to let it fly from distance.
  • Speaking to CNA, he said there's no added pressure to be compared with one of the best shooters in the modern game.
  • While the 23-year-old had hoped to be drafted earlier this year, he is keeping his NBA dream alive.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Finding faith in fitness: When gyms offer more than just a workout
description: With their intense solidarity and strict, hyper-focused routines, group fitness classes can also seem intimidating and even “cultish” to outsiders.

title: France bids final farewell to Olympics with Champs-Elysees parade

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• France bid a final and reluctant farewell to the Paris Olympics on Saturday (Sep 14) with a parade on the Champs-Elysees followed by a concert featuring artists from the opening and closing ceremonies.
  • He, Marchand and Rugby Sevens star Antoine Dupont were among more than 100 French medal winners who were awarded the Legion d'Honneur, France's highest civilian award, in a ceremony at the foot of the Arc de Triomphe led by French President Emmanuel Macron.
  • The centrist has also announced his intention to create an Olympics-inspired "national day of sport" every year on September 14.

#attributes.alt: France bids final farewell to Olympics with Champs-Elysees parade
#attributes.title: France bids final farewell to Olympics with Champs-Elysees parade

title: Raygun like 'singer who chose wrong song' but vitriol at breaker unwelcome: World body's Singaporean chief
description: "The ability and intent were there, but the performance itself simply did not resonate with the audience as envisaged," World DanceSport Federation president Shawn Tay told CNA.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• World DanceSport Federation (WDSF) president Shawn Tay told CNA that those who equate breaking solely with Rachael "Raygun" Gunn's maligned performance in the Paris Olympics are missing out on much more that the sport has to offer.
  • While Tay, a Singaporean, admitted that her performance at the Olympics did not resonate with the audience as envisaged, the resulting vitrol is unwelcome, he added.
  • "If there is one silver lining ... it's that this episode introduced breaking to countless numbers of people who may otherwise have never known that our sport was at the Olympic Games," said Tay.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Raygun like 'singer who chose wrong song' but vitriol at breaker unwelcome: World body's Singaporean chief
#attributes.title: Raygun like 'singer who chose wrong song' but vitriol at breaker unwelcome: World body's Singaporean chief

title: South Korea's Son Jun-ho denies Chinese accusations of football match-fixing

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• South Korean football player Son Jun-ho tearfully denied on Wednesday (Sep 11) accusations by Chinese authorities that he participated in match-fixing and bribery when playing in the country and said he gave a false confession under duress.
  • "I never took part in match-fixing," Son told a news conference. "The only evidence they have is my false confession made under coercion," he added, breaking down in tears.

title: Raygun's revenge: Lampooned Aussie breakdancer tops world rankings

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The World Dance Sport Federation (WDSF) named 37-year-old Rachael "Raygun" Gunn the number one female breakdancer in the world on Wednesday (Sep 11).
  • This comes after her kangaroo-inspired routine failed to impress the judges at the Paris Olympics, where the sport of breaking made its debut.
  • Wednesday's rankings were based on athletes' four top performances within the past 12 months and will change after the 12-month points expire, said the WDSF.

#attributes.alt: Raygun's revenge: Lampooned Aussie breakdancer tops world rankings
#attributes.title: Raygun's revenge: Lampooned Aussie breakdancer tops world rankings

title: Chinese athletes eye new sports at next Olympics, including American-dominant flag football
description: Flag football's Olympic inclusion means the non-contact, fast-paced team sport will soon become more widely played and competitive.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The dust has barely settled from the recent Paris Olympics, but Chinese athletes are already setting their sights on and training hard for the next Summer Games in Los Angeles.
  • Many in the country are optimistic that new additions to the sports lineup in the next Games, such as squash and flag football, could help improve their medal haul.
  • Under China’s 14th five-year plan, it aims to grow the sports industry to almost US$700 billion by 2025, from less than US$200 billion in 2014.

author: Lauren Ong

title: China slaps lifetime football bans on 43 over gambling, match-fixing
description: International midfielder Son Jun-ho returned to South Korea in March this year after being held in China since May 2023.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Chinese football on Tuesday (Sep 10) banned 43 people for life over alleged gambling and match-fixing.
  • This included three former China internationals and South Korean player Son Jun-ho, state news agency Xinhua said.
  • The 43 were among 128 people implicated in total in a two-year probe into illegal gambling and match-fixing in the domestic game, China's public security ministry said.

title: Warm welcome for Singapore's returning Paralympians after landmark showing at Games
description: Team Singapore concluded their Games campaign with two gold and one silver.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The contingent of athletes and officials touched down at about 6am, and were welcomed with loud cheers and applause when they eventually emerged into the arrival hall at Terminal 3.

  • Team Singapore's contingent of 10 athletes concluded their Games campaign with three medals - two gold and one silver.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Kendrick Lamar to headline 2025 Super Bowl halftime show

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Grammy-winning rapper Kendrick Lamar will headline next year's Super Bowl halftime show in New Orleans, the artist confirmed in a statement on Sunday (Sep 8).
  • "Few artists have impacted music and culture as profoundly as Kendrick Lamar," the NFL's head of music Seth Dudowsky said in a statement.
  • "We're excited to collaborate with Kendrick, (entertainment company) Roc Nation, and Apple Music to deliver another unforgettable halftime show”.

title: IN FOCUS: With six Olympic medals in 76 years, how can Singapore improve on its tally?
description: The country's leaders have outlined "a new path to sporting success". CNA takes a closer look at the ingredients.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• In a speech in August aptly titled “a new path to sporting success in Singapore”, Minister for Community, Culture and Youth Edwin Tong highlighted several initiatives to achieve this, days after the conclusion of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. These include a scholarship for student-athletes and continued support for niche and uncommon sports, among others. 
  • In a key speech the same month, Prime Minister Lawrence Wong also spoke about Singapore’s performance at the recently concluded Games, where he said that sports is “not just about medals”.
  • Will these initiatives and suggested mindset shifts be enough? Singapore's sports fraternity weigh in on what seems to be emerging as a strategy for greater sporting excellence in the future.

author: Justin Ong Guang-Xi

#attributes.alt: IN FOCUS: With six Olympic medals in 76 years, how can Singapore improve on its tally?
#attributes.title: IN FOCUS: With six Olympic medals in 76 years, how can Singapore improve on its tally?

title: Anger, scorn from Chinese football fans after Japan thrashes China 7-0 in record World Cup qualifier loss
description: China's football dream is fast fading, angry fans say, following its record World Cup qualifier loss to Japan.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• China’s national team faced scorn and backlash online from football fans and media following their humiliating 7-0 loss to World Cup rivals Japan.

  • President Xi Jinping, reportedly a big football fan, once expressed his hopes to turn the country into a “global football superpower.”

  • But the sport has long grappled with corruption, which fans have long blamed for the country’s poor performances.

title: Ugandan athlete Cheptegei dies after fire attack by boyfriend

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Ugandan Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei died in Kenya on Thursday (Sep 5), four days after being set on fire by her boyfriend in an attack in her home. The 33-year-old long-distance runner died at about 5.30am (2.30am GMT), the doctor treating her at a hospital in Eldoret in western Kenya told reporters.

  • According to police, a man identified as Cheptegei's partner, Dickson Ndiema Marangach, doused her with petrol and set her alight last Sunday at her home in Endebess in the western county of Trans-Nzoia.

  • The attack took place just weeks after Cheptegei had taken part in the marathon at the Paris Olympics, where she finished in 44th place.

#attributes.alt: Ugandan athlete Cheptegei dies after fire attack by boyfriend
#attributes.title: Ugandan athlete Cheptegei dies after fire attack by boyfriend

title: Athletes with disabilities to have dedicated training facilities at Team Singapore’s upcoming Kallang premises
description: Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong said his ministry has been working with the Singapore Disability Sports Council and Singapore National Paralympic Council in the planning and design of the new centre.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• An upcoming sports facility in Singapore will also cater to athletes with disabilities, in order to get them on the same footing as their able-bodied counterparts, said Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong.
  • A centralised and purpose-built facility for disability sports in Kallang will enable training to be more accessible for para-athletes, said Singapore Disability Sports Council executive director Kelly Fan.
  • Ms Fan added that considerations to make the facility accessible for disability athletes is include whether the facility would be on ground level or lift levels.

author: Sabrina Ng

#attributes.alt: Athletes with disabilities to have dedicated training facilities at Team Singapore’s upcoming Kallang premises
#attributes.title: Athletes with disabilities to have dedicated training facilities at Team Singapore’s upcoming Kallang premises

title: Plan to keep Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower sparks criticism

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Plans by Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo to keep the Olympic rings on the Eiffel Tower have been condemned by designer Gustave Eiffel's descendants and provoked a backlash from some Parisians.

  • The giant rings were a popular addition to the monument for visitors and tourists in Paris during the Jul 28 to Aug 11 Olympic Games in the French capital.

  • Hidalgo announced on Saturday (Aug 31) that she intended to take down the originals, which are too heavy to remain on the monument, and replace them with new rings.

title: Singapore's Jeralyn Tan clinches historic boccia silver medal at Paris Paralympics
description: She becomes only Singapore's fourth Paralympic medallist, joining swimmers Yip Pin Xiu, Theresa Goh and equestrian Laurentia Tan in the history books.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Jeralyn Tan clinched a historic boccia silver for Singapore at the Paris Paralympics on Monday (Sep 2), the country's very first medal in the sport.
  • She lost to Frenchwoman Aurelie Aubert, whom she had defeated in the earlier rounds but managed to turn things around in Monday's final.
  • Aubert stormed out of the blocks with a near-invulnerable lead after two rounds and saw off a valiant comeback by Tan to eventually win 5-4.

#attributes.alt: Singapore's Jeralyn Tan clinches historic boccia silver medal at Paris Paralympics
#attributes.title: Singapore's Jeralyn Tan clinches historic boccia silver medal at Paris Paralympics

title: Timeline: How Singapore swimmer Yip Pin Xiu blazed a trail to successive Paralympic glory
description: This is the journey of Singapore’s most decorated Paralympian, who has seven golds and one silver since making her Games debut in 2008.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Already one of Singapore’s most legendary athletes, swimmer Yip Pin Xiu added more feathers in her cap with two gold medals at the ongoing Paris Paralympics.
  • She has now amassed seven Paralympic gold medals since making her Games debut in 2008.
  • Yip remains the only Singaporean para-athlete to have won gold at the Paralympics.

author: Matthew Mohan

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Yip Pin Xiu clocked a time of 1:05.99 in the women's 50m backstroke S2 to clinch her second gold of the Paris Paralympics.
  • Her latest medal means she has won golds at both the 50m and 100m backstroke S2 events for three consecutive Paralympics.

title: Singapore swimmer Yip Pin Xiu wins second gold at Paris Paralympics
description: Yip Pin Xiu clocked a time of 1:05.99 to win the 50m backstroke S2 event.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Days after notching a historic three-peat, Singapore's Yip Pin Xiu registered another by winning the women’s 50m backstroke S2 final at the Paris Paralympics on Sunday (Sep 1).
  • At the La Defense Arena, the defending champion and fastest qualifier from the heats clocked a time of 1:05.99 to clinch her second gold of the Games.

title: 'It's been phenomenal': Singapore's Yip Pin Xiu reflects on Paralympics gold, historic three-peat
description: Yip won gold in the women’s 100m backstroke S2 event at the Paris Paralympics on Friday (Aug 30), notching a remarkable three-peat of golds.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• At the La Defense Arena on Friday (Aug 30), Yip Pin Xiu won gold in the women’s 100m backstroke S2 final, notching a remarkable three-peat.
  • The defending champion clocked a time of 2:21.73 to clinch Singapore’s first medal of the Paris Paralympics.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 'It's been phenomenal': Singapore's Yip Pin Xiu reflects on Paralympics gold, historic three-peat

title: 5 things to know about Yip Pin Xiu, Singapore's six-time Paralympic gold medallist
description: Yip won her latest gold in the 100m backstroke S2 final at the Paris Paralympics on Friday (Aug 30).

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore swim star Yip Pin Xiu has notched a remarkable three-peat of Paralympic golds in the women's 100m backstroke S2 event, after emerging victorious at Paris 2024 on Friday (Aug 30).
  • She was born with Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, which causes the progressive loss of muscle tissue and touch. She has been wheelchair-bound from her early teens.
  • Yip also has a number of World Championships and Asian Para Games medals to her name.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 5 things to know about Yip Pin Xiu, Singapore's six-time Paralympic gold medallist
#attributes.title: 5 things to know about Yip Pin Xiu, Singapore's six-time Paralympic gold medallist

title: Commentary: Why aren’t the Olympics and Paralympics combined into one Games?
description: A combined Olympic and Paralympic Games would include approximately 15,000 athletes over 50 sporting disciplines, says this professor.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The sheer size of such an event would make it impossible for almost any city to host a single combined Olympic and Paralympic Games, says this professor.
  • Beyond logistical concerns, some supporters of the Paralympic Games see the need and value for a separate event that showcases and highlights elite athletes with disabilities.

author: Laura Misener

#attributes.alt: Commentary: Why aren’t the Olympics and Paralympics combined into one Games?
#attributes.title: Commentary: Why aren’t the Olympics and Paralympics combined into one Games?

title: Paris Paralympics: Singapore’s Yip Pin Xiu wins gold in 100m backstroke S2 event
description: This is Singapore’s first medal at the 2024 Paralympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore's Yip Pin Xiu notched a historic three-peat on Friday (Aug 30) after winning the women’s 100m backstroke S2 final at the Paris Paralympics.
  • At the La Defense Arena, the defending champion clocked a time of 2:21.73 to clinch Singapore’s first medal of the Paris Games.
  • The now six-time Paralympic gold medallist is among three Team Singapore para swimmers who have qualified for this year’s Games.

author: Matthew Mohan

• Singapore's Yip Pin Xiu has qualified for the 100m backstroke S2 final at the Paris Paralympics after topping the heats on Thursday (Aug 29).
  • Yip, the defending champion and the current world record holder in the event, will compete in the finals on Friday at 12.10am Singapore time.

title: Singapore para-shooter Daniel Chan to make Paralympics debut in Paris
description: The para-shooter will represent Singapore in the P1 men's 10m air pistol SH1.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Daniel Chan is Singapore’s first para-shooter to compete in the Paralympic Games.
  • He will represent Singapore in the P1 men's 10m air pistol SH1 and will make his debut on the Paralympics stage on Friday (Aug 30) in qualifiers.
  • Chan was first introduced to the sport during national service when his unit took part in a competition.

  • International Paralympic Committee (IPC) president Andrew Parsons told the athletes and spectators he hoped for an "inclusion revolution", before French President Emmanuel Macron officially declared the Games open.

title: Singapore's footballers to play 3 matches against Japanese clubs instead of international friendlies
description: The Lions will also play two training matches at home ahead of the ASEAN Football Federation Championship, which starts in December.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore men's football team will play against top Japanese league sides instead of international friendlies ahead of the ASEAN Football Federation (AFF) Championship.
  • The Lions will also play two home training matches, against BG Tampines Rovers and Malaysia’s Johor Darul Ta’zim.
  • After the Japan training camp in October, the Lions will play international friendlies against Myanmar and Chinese Taipei in November.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: National para-athlete body calls for more recognition, support for its members
description: Ten Team Singapore para-athletes will compete in six sports, including swimming and archery, at the Paris Paralympic Games.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Singapore National Paralympic Council has called for more support and recognition of its athletes as they prepare to compete in the Paralympic Games 2024.
  • In total, 10 Team Singapore para-athletes will compete in six sports at the Paris Games: Boccia, archery, shooting, swimming, equestrian, and athletics (shot put).
  • The athletes need to know that Singaporeans are standing behind them, said the council's president, who added that there is also a need for financial support.

author: Sabrina Ng

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore's wushu exponents clinched five gold medals, four silvers and five bronzes at the World Taijiquan Championships held at the OCBC Arena.
  • Singapore Wushu Dragon and Lion Dance Federation CEO Leow Meng Hong said the target had been four golds and the athletes exceeded expectations.
  • Singapore's wushu scene has grown in the last four to five years, he added.

title: Golfer Shannon Tan becomes first Singaporean woman to make cut at a Major

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Golfer Shannon Tan made history once again on Friday (Aug 23) as she became the first Singaporean woman to make the cut at a Major.
  • Tan made the four-over cut at the Women's Open at St Andrews comfortably, shooting a three-under 69 at the Old Course on Friday to sit on even par after two rounds.
  • She is currently in a tie for 21st place, eight shots behind leader – and world No 1 – Nelly Korda of the United States.

title: National athletes can apply for undergraduate scholarship, to get CPF top-ups under spex scheme
description: The scholarship is open to active athletes prior to pursuing their full-time undergraduate degree, as well as active athletes pursuing their undergraduate studies.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• A new scholarship for undergraduate student-athletes, along with CPF top-ups for spexScholars, was announced by Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong on Wednesday (Aug 21).
  • The scholarship is open to active athletes prior to pursuing their full-time undergraduate degree, as well as active athletes pursuing their undergraduate studies, said the Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth (MCCY) in a factsheet.
  • Athletes under the spexScholarship scheme will also receive monthly top-ups to their CPF accounts from April next year.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: National athletes can apply for undergraduate scholarship, to get CPF top-ups under spex scheme
#attributes.title: National athletes can apply for undergraduate scholarship, to get CPF top-ups under spex scheme

title: 'A fresh start': Singapore Sports School's Kallang move will boost larger ecosystem, say current and ex-students
description: Less time spent commuting and being able to train with top athletes will be major pluses, they tell CNA.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The decision to move the Singapore Sports School (SSP) from Woodlands to Kallang will benefit not only student-athletes but the larger sporting ecosystem, current and former students of the school told CNA.
  • Prime Minister Lawrence Wong had revealed at his first National Day Rally that Kallang would be a new “home” for Team Singapore, with plans for new sports science and sports medicine facilities as well as national training centres integrated and sited under one roof.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 'A fresh start': Singapore Sports School's Kallang move will boost larger ecosystem, say current and ex-students

title: Niche sports in Singapore hope kitefoiling's Olympic glow helps buoy their communities
description: Athletes in niche sports are calling for more support in funding, raising awareness, and increasing the number of available venues.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Athletes from such less common sports are hoping that Max Maeder's bronze medal win at the recent Olympic Games – in the niche event of kitefoiling – will ignite participation, support and funding for their communities.
  • These sports include kettlebell and aerial sports
  • Last week, Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong said the government will support athletes who show promise regardless of whether they are in mainstream sports or in less common ones.

title: Sinner beats Tiafoe to win Cincinnati Open

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• World number one Jannik Sinner beat Frances Tiafoe 7-6(4) 6-2 at the Cincinnati Open final, showing that despite recent health struggles he will still be the man to beat at the upcoming US Open in New York.
  • Sinner's triumph at the Masters 1000 event follows his Grand Slam breakthrough at the Australian Open in January and is his fifth title of the year and first at the tournament in Ohio.
  • Tiafoe will rise to world number 20 and will take confidence into the US Open after his gutsy three-set win over Dane Holger Rune in Sunday's semi-final.

title: Sabalenka overpowers American Pegula to win Cincinnati Open

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Aryna Sabalenka harnessed her powerful serve to subdue American Jessica Pegula 6-3 7-5 and win the Cincinnati Open, sending a message ahead of the year's final major in New York.
  • The twice Australian Open champion dropped only nine points on serve and hit 10 aces as Sabalenka overcame some jitters late in the second set in an otherwise confident performance to pick up her sixth WTA 1000 title.
  • The performance removed any possible doubt that Sabalenka is one of the hot favourites in Flushing, despite a shoulder injury earlier this season that forced Sabalenka to miss Wimbledon.

#attributes.alt: Sabalenka overpowers American Pegula to win Cincinnati Open
#attributes.title: Sabalenka overpowers American Pegula to win Cincinnati Open

description: Prime Minister Lawrence Wong said this will allow student athletes to study and train together with senior athletes.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Prime Minister Lawrence Wong announced that the Singapore Sports School will move from Woodlands to Kallang.
  • In his National Day Rally speech on Sunday (Aug 18), Mr Wong also revealed plans for new sports science and sports medicine facilities, and the integration of national training centres for several “key sports” at Kallang.
  • He said that the government will make Kallang a place for all Singaporeans to enjoy sports.

title: Singapore goalkeeper Hassan Sunny announces retirement from international football

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• “After 20 years and 115 international caps since my international debut in 2004, it is time to announce my retirement from the international stage,” Hassan Sunny said in a Facebook post on Sunday (Aug 18).
  • The Singapore goalkeeper became a celebrity with Chinese supporters after the Lions’ World Cup qualifier against Thailand, which Singapore lost 3-1.
  • “Now, the time has come for me to step aside and let the younger goalkeepers take over. I will always give my utmost support to the goalkeeping department and the team, and will always be rooting for them.”

#attributes.alt: Singapore goalkeeper Hassan Sunny announces retirement from international football
#attributes.title: Singapore goalkeeper Hassan Sunny announces retirement from international football

title: ActiveSG users unhappy over switch to new booking platform, say it is confusing and more troublesome
description: The new web-based booking platform, known as MyActiveSG+, was introduced to combat the use of bots and multiple accounts to book its sports facilities.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Sport Singapore introduced a new web-based booking platform, known as MyActiveSG+, on Jun 15 to combat the use of bots and multiple accounts to book its sports facilities.
  • Users said they preferred some functions on the previous platform, such as the e-wallet for payments.
  • Those buying day passes to an ActiveSG gym or swimming pool have to use them within the same day.

title: 'It’s beautiful to see': Singaporeans turn out in force to support Olympians on bus parade through the city
description: The open-top bus parade, which included Olympic medallist Max Maeder, passed landmarks such as Marina Bay Sands, Little India, Orchard Road and Chinatown.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• "It’s beautiful to see ... my heart melted, and I am very happy to see that people enjoyed the fact that we, as Team Singapore, came through and gave a wave hello to everyone," said Max Maeder after the parade.
  • On National Day, Maeder became the sixth Singaporean to win an Olympic medal, with a bronze in kitefoiling at the Paris Games.
  • On how he hopes Olympic athletes can inspire young Singaporeans, Maeder said: "What I would say so far is, please, give yourself a shot, because you are capable of so much more than you would believe. And trust me, you will surprise yourself."

author: Justin Ong Guang-Xi

#attributes.alt: 'It’s beautiful to see': Singaporeans turn out in force to support Olympians on bus parade through the city
#attributes.title: 'It’s beautiful to see': Singaporeans turn out in force to support Olympians on bus parade through the city

title: As it happened: Open-top bus parade for Team Singapore's Olympic athletes

fast.tickaroo_body:
Our journey - like the bus the Singapore Olympic athletes were on - has come to an end, for now.

Many of the athletes will, no doubt, be taking a much-deserved break but you can bet LA 2028 won't be far from their plans.

We hope you enjoyed our live coverage, as much as we did bringing it to you.

video.label: [LIVE] Open-top bus parade for Team Singapore's Paris Olympics athletes, including Max Maeder PART 2
video.caption: Team Singapore Olympians are going around central Singapore as part of a celebratory open-top bus parade on Aug 14. The athletes on the bus are: Kitefoiler and Paris Games bronze medallist Max Maeder, sailing's Ryan Lo, sprinter Marc Brian Louis, badminton’s Yeo Jia Min, Terry Hee and Jessica Tan, kayaker Stephenie Chen, swimmer Gan Ching Hwee, and table tennis players Izaac Quek and Zhou Jingyi. The bus parade started at 11.30am and has gone past Marina Bay Sands, Chinatown, Orchard Road, Serangoon Road. It will end at Victoria Street. Read our live blog: https://cna.asia/4cwG408 More details on the parade: https://cna.asia/46Juo8N

#attributes.alt: As it happened: Open-top bus parade for Team Singapore's Olympic athletes
#attributes.title: As it happened: Open-top bus parade for Team Singapore's Olympic athletes

title: A 'good lesson' for the future: Max Maeder's coach on ups and downs of historic Olympic outing
description: "When you're coming in like the biggest favourite it is a disadvantage. There's a lot of pressure on you," says Ivica Dolenc, who has trained the Singaporean since he was 14.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• "You could see from the early beginning that he's showing potential, big potential," according to the coach of Singaporean kitefoiler and Olympic bronze medallist Max Maeder.
  • Croatian Ivica Dolenc, who has trained Maeder since he was 14, tells CNA about the factors that complicated his athlete's pursuit of a medal at Paris 2024.
  • Maeder, already a double world champion and Olympic podium finisher at just 17, will learn from the experience and has a big future ahead of him, says his coach.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: A 'good lesson' for the future: Max Maeder's coach on ups and downs of historic Olympic outing
#attributes.title: A 'good lesson' for the future: Max Maeder's coach on ups and downs of historic Olympic outing

title: Commentary: After Singapore shuttlers’ performance at Paris Olympics, badminton is coming home
description: Despite not taking the podium, the Paris Olympic quartet of Yeo Jia Min, Loh Kean Yew, Terry Hee and Jessica Tan have brought badminton home for Singapore, says sports observer Jan Lin Lee.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The emergence of the Paris 2024 Olympic badminton quartet - Loh Kean Yew, Terry Hee, Jessica Tan and Yeo Jia Min - was made possible by the unique, all-rounded training they received during their teenage years.
  • They convey the message that if they can compete at the world’s biggest stage, so too can the Singaporean children who aspire to be like them, says sports observer Jan Lin Lee.

author: Jan Lin Lee

#attributes.alt: Commentary: After Singapore shuttlers’ performance at Paris Olympics, badminton is coming home
#attributes.title: Commentary: After Singapore shuttlers’ performance at Paris Olympics, badminton is coming home

title: Breaking community defends B-girl Raygun and is hopeful for return to Olympic programme

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The breaking community wants the world to give B-girl Raygun a break.

  • The sport made its Olympic debut in Paris - it might never be back - and one of the lasting images was the performance of an Australian B-girl known as Raygun who did a “kangaroo dance” and scored zero points.

  • In a show of support on Sunday (Aug 11), the head judge of the breaking competition said 36-year-old university professor Rachael Gunn was just trying to be original. And the breaking federation says it has offered mental health support in the wake of online criticism.

#attributes.alt: Breaking community defends B-girl Raygun and is hopeful for return to Olympic programme

title: Fans, sailing fraternity show up bright and early to welcome home Olympic medallist Max Maeder
description: The 17-year-old became Singapore’s youngest Olympic medallist – and only the nation’s sixth – at the Paris Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Supporters and members of the sailing fraternity gathered at Changi Airport to witness a rare sight – a Singaporean returning from an Olympic Games with a medal around his neck.

  • Kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder, Singapore’s youngest Olympic medallist at just 17, landed in Singapore at about 6am on Tuesday (Aug 13), and emerged in the arrival area at about 6.25am to jubilant applause and cheers from a crowd of about 50 people.

  • Wearing the bronze medal which he won at the Paris Olympics, he hugged family members, posed for pictures with supporters, signed autographs and even picked up several young fans who had woken up as early as 4am to make the journey down to see their new sporting idol.

author: Justin Ong Guang-Xi

#attributes.alt: Fans, sailing fraternity show up bright and early to welcome home Olympic medallist Max Maeder
#attributes.title: Fans, sailing fraternity show up bright and early to welcome home Olympic medallist Max Maeder

title: Olympic flag arrives in Los Angeles, host city for 2028 Games

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Olympic flag arrived in Los Angeles, where it will be flown in 2028 when the city hosts the next Summer Games.
  • Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass stepped off the plane dressed in a red Team USA tracksuit, smiled broadly and waved the Olympic flag before descending airstairs to be greeted by California Governor Gavin Newsom.
  • The International Olympic Committee awarded Los Angeles the right in 2017 to host the 2028 Games, it will be the third time LA has hosted the Games in the modern era, after being the host city in 1932 and 1984.

#attributes.alt: Olympic flag arrives in Los Angeles, host city for 2028 Games
#attributes.title: Olympic flag arrives in Los Angeles, host city for 2028 Games

title: Commentary: The untold story behind Max Maeder’s Olympic medal - former national sailor Ben Tan gives an insider's view
description: Max Maeder’s Olympic medal was won through deliberate engineering - by him, his parents and Singapore’s extensive sports ecosystem, says former national sailor and Olympian Ben Tan.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• In 2018, a close friend of the Maeder family and a fellow kiteboarder alerted former national sailor Ben Tan to a wonderkid on the professional kite racing circuit.
  • He travelled the following year to Wakatobi, an island off Sulawesi, to meet Max Maeder, who was then 12 years old.
  • On Aug 9, Maeder, now 17, clinched bronze in the men's final at the Paris Olympics, becoming the youngest Singaporean to stand on a Games podium.

author: Ben Tan

#attributes.alt: Commentary: The untold story behind Max Maeder’s Olympic medal - former national sailor Ben Tan gives an insider's view
#attributes.title: Commentary: The untold story behind Max Maeder’s Olympic medal - former national sailor Ben Tan gives an insider's view

title: Paris bids farewell to memorable Olympic Games with celebratory closing ceremony
description: Singapore's flag bearers at the ceremony were Olympic bronze medallist Maximilian Maeder and kayaker Stephenie Chen.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• It was "au revoir" to an Olympic Games of spectacular venues, exuberant crowds and special moments on Sunday (Aug 11), with a finale fitting of the occasion.

  • At the Stade de France, more than 70,000 enjoyed an extravaganza celebrating not only athletes but Paris itself as well.

  • Singapore's flag bearers at the ceremony were newly minted Olympic bronze medallist Maximilian Maeder and kayaker Stephenie Chen.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Paris Games reboot Olympic brand, raising bar for LA

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• "France surprised people," said Michael Payne, a former IOC marketing chief who has also worked with bid cities and sponsors, especially as recent Paris events such as the 2022 UEFA Champions League final had been marred by trouble.
  • Payne said the success of Paris "will reboot cities' interest in bidding to host the Games". He said he had already noticed several eyeing 2036.
  • By avoiding costly white elephants, and prioritising temporary stadiums nestled among some of the world's most recognisable landmarks, French organisers have turned Paris into an open-air Olympic playground where everyone's invited, with or without a ticket.

#attributes.alt: Paris Games reboot Olympic brand, raising bar for LA
#attributes.title: Paris Games reboot Olympic brand, raising bar for LA

title: Tom Cruise leaps into action as Los Angeles takes on Olympic mission
description: The Top Gun actor rappelled from the roof of the Stade de France into the Paris Games closing ceremony.

fast.headline_ovride_for_shorts: Tom Cruise leaps into action as Los Angeles takes on Olympic mission
fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Tom Cruise rappelled from the roof of the Stade de France into the Paris Games closing ceremony before speeding off with the Olympic flag in a dramatic handover that began the countdown to the Los Angeles Games in 2028.
  • The closing ceremony then transitioned to a prerecorded video of Cruise skydiving down to the Hollywood sign, where a wide shot showed the Olympic rings incorporated into the famous LA landmark.

#attributes.alt: Tom Cruise leaps into action as Los Angeles takes on Olympic mission
#attributes.title: Tom Cruise leaps into action as Los Angeles takes on Olympic mission

title: Griner's gold medal extra special after Russian prison

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• On the highest step of the Olympic podium, US basketball player Brittney Griner wept, tears trickling down her face as her country's national anthem serenaded her for a gold medal she could not have imagined winning while in a Russian prison.
  • "I didn't think I would be here," the 33-year-old said after the United States beat France 67-66 in the gold medal game at the Paris Olympics on Sunday. "And then to be here and winning gold for my country, representing when my country fought for me so hard to even be standing here."

title: Open-top bus parade for Team Singapore Olympians to be held on Aug 14
description: The celebratory parade will take place from 11.30am to 1pm in the city area.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• An open-top bus parade to celebrate Team Singapore's Olympians will held on Aug 14.
  • The parade will pass through Bayfront Avenue, Chinatown, Orchard Road, Serangoon Road and Victoria Street.
  • Athletes likely to be present include Olympic bronze medallist Max Maeder, the badminton mixed doubles pair of Terry Hee and Jessica Tan, as well as swimmer Gan Ching Hwee.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Paris Olympics a platform for Singapore's athletes to build on, learn to land 'winning touch': Top sports official
description: Singapore Sports Institute (SSI) chief Su Chun Wei said that the contingent is a young one and will learn with experience.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• While not all of Singapore's athletes may have been able to land the 'winning touch' at the Paris Olympics, the Games will provide the experience for them to learn and grow, said Singapore Sports Institute chief Su Chun Wei.
  • "They have an indomitable fighting spirit. But I agree that learning to win that winning point takes experience, and our consolation and optimism is that our cohort of Olympians ... have cycles ahead," he said.
  • "I'm pretty sure that this particular campaign will spur them to do much more and much better and to be the best version of themselves that they have not already discovered," Dr Su said.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Paris Olympics a platform for Singapore's athletes to build on, learn to land 'winning touch': Top sports official
#attributes.title: Paris Olympics a platform for Singapore's athletes to build on, learn to land 'winning touch': Top sports official

title: 5 things to know about Maximilian Maeder, Singapore's newest Olympic medallist
description: The 17-year-old kitefoiler clinched bronze at Paris 2024.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• On Friday (Aug 9), 17-year-old Maximilian Maeder clinched an Olympic bronze medal in the men's kitefoiling final at Paris 2024, becoming the youngest Singaporean to stand on a Games podium.
  • He has already achieved much in the sporting arena, even before this year's Olympics, having been ranked No 1 globally and won two world championships, three European titles and an Asian Games gold medal.
  • "It's about the process and it's about the journey in the sense that every time you get to compete, you get to go through the experience ... you get to show your skill, you get to bring others along," he has said.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 5 things to know about Maximilian Maeder, Singapore's newest Olympic medallist
#attributes.title: 5 things to know about Maximilian Maeder, Singapore's newest Olympic medallist

title: Timeline: Maximilian Maeder's road to an Olympic medal - and a place in Singapore's sporting history
description: CNA follows the 17-year-old kitefoiler's journey from his unique childhood to a medal at Paris 2024 and a place in the record books.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• With his Olympics bronze on Friday (Aug 9), kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder ended Singapore's eight-year wait for a Games medal.
  • Just two years ago - aged only 15 - he burst onto the scene with European and youth world championships wins, establishing himself as a high-level contender.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Timeline: Maximilian Maeder's road to an Olympic medal - and a place in Singapore's sporting history
#attributes.title: Timeline: Maximilian Maeder's road to an Olympic medal - and a place in Singapore's sporting history

title: Paris Olympics: Japan's B-Girl Ami wins first breaking gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Japan's Ami Yuasa blended artistry and athleticism to win a battle against Lithuania's Dominika Banevic and dance her way to the first Olympic gold medal ever awarded for breaking on Friday (Aug 9).
  • China's Liu Qingyi, B-Girl 671, took bronze after overpowering India Sardjoe, B-Girl India, 2-1 in the bronze medal battle in the cypher (circle).
  • "We made history tonight. Breaking's first time at the Olympics," said Banevic. "I'm so happy people could feel our energy and see how wonderful breaking is. More and more people will be interested in breaking now. It's a unique art form."

#attributes.alt: Paris Olympics: Japan's B-Girl Ami wins first breaking gold
#attributes.title: Paris Olympics: Japan's B-Girl Ami wins first breaking gold

title: Dominican Republic's Paulino surges to 400m gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Dominican Republic's Marileidy Paulino surged to victory in the 400 metres to add Olympic gold to her world title on a rainy night at the Stade de France on Friday (Aug 9) and said she hoped her achievement would inspire youngsters in her country.
  • Paulino had been unbeaten over the distance at four consecutive meets this year and stormed to a comfortable lead halfway through the lap before finishing in 48.17 seconds on a track still wet from earlier rain showers.
  • The Dominican had a slower start than her rivals but demonstrated her racing prowess by reeling in the early front-runners with a powerful kick that powered her to break the Olympic record set in 1996 by France's Marie-Jose Perec.

#attributes.alt: Dominican Republic's Paulino surges to 400m gold
#attributes.title: Dominican Republic's Paulino surges to 400m gold

title: 'Waited our whole lives for this': Singapore sailing community celebrates Max Maeder's bronze medal
description: Former sailors hail Max Maeder's bronze medal as a fantastic result despite hopes for a gold.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Former sailors on Friday (Aug 9) hailed Max Maeder's bronze medal as a fantastic result despite hopes for a gold.
  • "It's a stellar result. We've waited our whole lives for this," said former national sailor Koh Seng Leong.
  • Former sailor Mok Kahmun said Maeder is likely to be his own toughest critic: "But he still got up on his board and flew the flag high, which I thought was very sweet, although inside he must feel really crushed."

author: Abigail Ng

title: 'Heartbroken' but proud, Max Maeder’s parents reflect on their child's historic Olympic medal for Singapore
description: "I know my son ... he felt like he let a lot of people down,” the 17-year-old kitefoiler's mother tells CNA.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• World champion kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder clinched a bronze medal at the Paris Olympics on Friday (Aug 9), ending Singapore’s eight-year wait for an Olympic podium finish since swimmer Joseph Schooling won gold in 2016.
  • Despite his historic achievement, Maximilian Maeder expressed mixed emotions, stating, "I'll speak the truth and say I haven't finished sulking, but I'm putting a smile on now, not because I have to, but because of the way I feel and… I still need to process everything that's going on because, yeah, it's a lot.”
  • His mother told CNA that she was heartbroken because her son was sad.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 'Heartbroken' but proud, Max Maeder’s parents reflect on their child's historic Olympic medal for Singapore
#attributes.title: 'Heartbroken' but proud, Max Maeder’s parents reflect on their child's historic Olympic medal for Singapore

description: "I'll speak the truth and say I haven't finished sulking," the teen kitefoiler says.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Maximilian Maeder was overwhelmed when speaking to reporters on Friday (Aug 9) after he clinched an Olympic bronze medal in the men’s kitefoiling event, ending Singapore's eight-year wait for a Games podium finish since swimmer Joseph Schooling won gold in 2016.
  • Maeder, 17, has also become the youngest Singaporean to win an Olympic medal.

title: 'Beautiful birthday gift': Singapore leaders congratulate Max Maeder on Olympic bronze
description: Kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder is Singapore's youngest Olympic medallist, at 17 years old.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Maximilian Maeder, 17, clinched the kitefoiling bronze on Friday (Aug 9), marking Singapore's first Olympic medal in eight years and the country's first sailing medal at an Olympics.
  • "Just as we completed our celebrations at the parade, Max Maeder overcame the tough conditions at sea and became the youngest Singaporean to win an Olympic medal," PM Lawrence Wong wrote.

title: Social media, movie theatres abuzz as Olympic fever hits Chinese fans
description: As the Olympic Games draw near to the finish line this weekend, fans are excited to see the gold medals rack up – China and the United States are almost neck-to-neck at the top of the table.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Sports fans in China are bringing their popcorn into movie theatres to catch the Olympic action on the big screens – broadcast live from Paris.
  • As the Olympic Games draw near to the finish line this weekend, fans are excited to see the gold medals rack up – China and the United States are almost neck-to-neck in the race to get the most golds.
  • However, politics have clouded the Olympic spirit, with tensions between China and the US spilling over into the competition arena amid ugly doping allegations.

author: Lauren Ong

  • Athletes in various stages of pregnancy have continually challenged the perception of what a woman can do while pregnant, but they need more support, say health experts from Western University.

title: McLaughlin-Levrone smashes world record to retain 400m hurdles crown

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• American Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone obliterated her own 400m hurdles world record with a time of 50.37 seconds to retain her Olympic title on Thursday (Aug 8).
  • The first woman to break the 52 and 51-second barriers, McLaughlin-Levrone has been on a mission to rewrite the history books whenever she competes, turning the 400m hurdles into a marquee event - and herself into a superstar - in the process.

title: Botswana's Tebogo becomes Africa's first 200m champion, beating COVID-stricken Noah Lyles

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Letsile Tebogo became the first African to win the men's Olympic 200m title on Thursday (Aug 8) when he powered clear of American duo Kenny Bednarek and a COVID-hit Noah Lyles to claim Botswana's first Olympic gold medal.
  • Tebogo, who set a national record of 9.86 when finishing sixth in the 100m final, produced a dominant last 50m and crossed the line in 19.46, becoming the fifth-fastest man in history over 200m.
  • Bednarek chased Tebogo all the way to take a second successive silver in 19.62, with Lyles repeating his Tokyo bronze in 19.67.

#attributes.alt: Botswana's Tebogo becomes Africa's first 200m champion, beating COVID-stricken Noah Lyles

title: Singapore kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder’s Olympic final postponed after one race contested
description: The 17-year-old finished second in the day’s only race out of a possible six.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore world champion kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder will have to wait longer in his bid for an Olympic medal, after the men’s final was postponed on Thursday (Aug 8) due to lack of wind.
  • The 17-year-old had finished second in the day’s first and only race, out of a possible six. The remaining races were then delayed to Friday, due to lack of wind.
  • The result means that Slovenia's Toni Vodisek still leads overall while Maeder and Austrian Valentin Bontus are tied on one race win.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: As it happened: A bronze for kitefoiler Max Maeder, Singapore’s first Olympic medallist in 8 years

fast.tickaroo_body:
We're about done here.

Thank you for sticking with us over the past two nights. We'll always remember the delays, the waiting and the perplexing kitefoiling rules ...

And how it was all worth it at the end. Congratulations again, Maximilian Maeder, Olympic bronze medallist! 

Good night, Singapore.

title: Singaporean footballer Danelle Tan signs for Australia's Brisbane Roar
description: The 19-year-old striker will join the professional side from German club Borussia Dortmund.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Danelle Tan, the first female Singaporean footballer to play in a European league, has joined Australia's Brisbane Roar, the A-League Women club announced on Thursday (Aug 8).

  • The 19-year-old striker will wear the No 9 jersey at the club and will link up with its squad next month ahead of the 2024-25 season of the A-League Women, which kicks off on Nov 1.

  • She announced in an Instagram post on Jul 22 that she had left her previous club, Germany's Borussia Dortmund, saying that she had "received several offers from professional clubs" and "decided a move would be best for (her) development".

author: Rachel Chan

title: 'I wanted to play for him': Singapore badminton player Loh Kean Yew a new father to a baby boy
description: Loh's wife gave birth to their son about two weeks ago while he was preparing for the Paris Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Loh Kean Yew had become a new father to a baby boy about two weeks ago, he revealed to reporters on Wednesday (Aug 7).
  • His wife had given birth while Loh was in Denmark for a training camp.
  • While first a sense of guilt for Loh at missing the birth of his first child, he "couldn't stop smiling after", he recalled.

title: Chinese diver Quan Hongchan's thoughts turn to food after winning 10m platform gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• China's Quan Hongchan said she was starving after she won a gold medal at the Paris Olympics in the women's 10m platform event on Tuesday (Aug 6).
  • The 17-year-old beat teammate Chen Yuxi, her partner in the synchronised event they won last week, to claim China's fifth diving gold of the Paris Olympics.
  • "I'm so hungry! I didn't eat anything since breakfast other than an energy bar and some milk tea I made myself," Quan told reporters after the victory ceremony.

#attributes.alt: Chinese diver Quan Hongchan's thoughts turn to food after winning 10m platform gold
#attributes.title: Chinese diver Quan Hongchan's thoughts turn to food after winning 10m platform gold

title: Khelif puts gender dispute aside to reach final as fans flock to support her

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Imane Khelif, one of the two boxers at the heart of a gender dispute at the Paris Olympics, vowed to put the controversy behind her and make Algeria and the Arab world proud.
  • Khelif and Taiwanese boxer Lin Yu-ting were disqualified by the International Boxing Association from the 2023 World Championships, with the body saying a sex chromosome test had ruled both of them ineligible.
  • Khelif and Lin are competing in the Olympics after the International Olympic Committee stripped the IBA of its status as the sport's governing body in 2023 and took control of organising the boxing in Paris.

#attributes.alt: Khelif puts gender dispute aside to reach final as fans flock to support her
#attributes.title: Khelif puts gender dispute aside to reach final as fans flock to support her

title: Commentary: ‘A fight to survive’ - former national swimmer Joscelin Yeo on the financial hurdles Singapore athletes face
description: Beyond government support, athletes often rely on their parents to support their sporting aspirations, find sponsors who are willing to give them cash or turn to crowdfunding, says former national swimmer and four-time Olympian Joscelin Yeo.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Being a professional athlete should be a full-time job in itself. Sports alone, however, is unlikely to cover the bills, says former national swimmer and four-time Olympian Joscelin Yeo.
  • Beyond government support, athletes often have to rely on parents, find sponsors or turn to crowdfunding.
  • More needs to be done to help Singapore's athletes focus purely on excelling in their chosen sport, without having to worry about bills.

author: Joscelin Yeo

#attributes.alt: Commentary: ‘A fight to survive’ - former national swimmer Joscelin Yeo on the financial hurdles Singapore athletes face
#attributes.title: Commentary: ‘A fight to survive’ - former national swimmer Joscelin Yeo on the financial hurdles Singapore athletes face

title: Dominant US sprinter Gabby Thomas lands first 200m global title

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• American Gabby Thomas finally claimed the global title she has promised for so long when she delivered a dominant performance to take Olympic 200m gold on Tuesday (Aug 6), denying silver medallist Julien Alfred a sprint double.
  • In control throughout the race, Thomas came home in 21.83 seconds and broke into a wide smile of disbelief, hands on her head, as she crossed the finish line.
  • Alfred, who claimed Saint Lucia’s first Olympic medal when she won the 100m on Saturday, was fastest out of the blocks but was a clear second in 22.08, with Brittany Brown taking bronze for the US in 20.20.

#attributes.alt: Dominant US sprinter Gabby Thomas lands first 200m global title
#attributes.title: Dominant US sprinter Gabby Thomas lands first 200m global title

title: 'A stud': Swim legend Michael Phelps hails retired Joseph Schooling's 'great career'
description: In a wide-ranging interview, the most-decorated Olympian of all time also spoke about the need for tougher sanctions for doping offences.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Joseph Schooling has had a "great career" and it has been "fun" to see the Singaporean retire from competitive swimming when he wanted to, said Olympic legend Michael Phelps on Monday (Aug 5) 
  • "I love Jojo. He's been an awesome competitor of mine," said the 39-year-old of Schooling who retired in April.
  • In a wide-ranging interview with reporters, Phelps also spoke about the need for tougher sanctions for doping offences.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: France beat Egypt 3-1 to reach first Olympic final in 40 years, will play Spain

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Hosts France will play an Olympic men's football final for the first time in 40 years after beating Egypt 3-1 in extra time at the Lyon stadium on Monday (Aug 5) and will face Spain for the gold medal.
  • Mateta got a double before Michael Olise scored in extra time to earn Thierry Henry's side the victory and extend their quest for a second Olympic title in Friday's final at Parc des Princes against Spain, who earlier beat Morocco 2-1.

title: Peerless Duplantis caps golden night with pole vault world record

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Sweden's Mondo Duplantis retained his Olympic pole vault title with ludicrous ease on Monday (Aug 5), needing only four successful attempts to take gold with 6.00m, then capped a memorable night by beating his own world record with a clearance of 6.25.
  • "The biggest dream since I was a kid was to break the world record at the Olympics, and I’ve been able to do that in front of the most ridiculous crowd I’ve ever competed in front of," said Duplantis.

title: 'It's going to make me stronger': Sprint queen Shanti Pereira vows comeback after Paris Olympics exit
description: “I’ve learnt that I can bounce back from hard things,” says Pereira, who added that she will be aiming to compete at the 2028 Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore sprint queen Shanti Pereira has vowed to come back stronger after exiting the Paris Olympics on Monday (Aug 5), finishing last in her 200m repechage heat. 
  • The Singaporean said that she’s learnt from going through tough times throughout her life and added that she will be eyeing one more shot - with Los Angeles 2028 being the goal. 
  • Her Olympics preparations were marred by a stress injury in her fibula.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: 'It's going to make me stronger': Sprint queen Shanti Pereira vows comeback after Paris Olympics exit
#attributes.title: 'It's going to make me stronger': Sprint queen Shanti Pereira vows comeback after Paris Olympics exit

title: No 200m semis spot for Singapore's Shanti Pereira after clocking 23.45s in second-chance heat
description: This marks the end of a difficult meet for the Asian Games 200m gold medallist who had her Olympics preparation cruelly curtailed by a stress injury in her fibula.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Sprinter Shanti Pereira’s Paris Olympics campaign ended on Monday (Aug 5) after she clocked a time of 23.45s in the repechage heats, finishing last out of seven competitors in heat 1.
  • There were four repechage heats on Monday, with six slots up to grabs. Only the athletes who topped each heat qualified for the semi-finals, as well as the next two with the fastest times across all four heats.
  • This marks the end of a difficult meet for the Asian Games 200m gold medallist who had her Olympics preparation cruelly curtailed by a stress injury in her fibula.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Seine triathlon swim may cause sickness, definitely caused stress

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Triathletes at the Paris Olympics shrugged off the risk of getting sick by swimming the Seine, but said that the repeated disruptions caused them stress.
  • The men's individual race was postponed at the last minute because bacteria levels in the river were too high.
  • French authorities have spent over a billion euros on upgrading the capital's sewage systems, though the change will come too late for the athletes.

title: Singapore swimmer Gan Ching Hwee nearly gave up on her Olympic dream. She's now inspiring the next wave
description: Fresh off setting two national records at the Paris Olympics, Gan Ching Hwee spoke to CNA about her strong support system and how she overcame self-doubt.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• On her Olympic debut at the Paris Games, Gan Ching Hwee set two national records in the 800m freestyle and the 1500m freestyle.
  • She spoke to CNA about a whirlwind few months which saw her consider giving up her Olympic dream, nearly suffer the disappointment of missing out on the Games for a second time and making the trip to Paris.

title: Taiwan cheers Olympics badminton triumph over China in politically charged contest

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• People across Taiwan on Sunday (Aug 4) celebrated their men's doubles badminton gold medal victory over Chinese opponents that sparked scenes of jubilation while also exposing deeper geopolitical divides between the two sides.

  • Wang Chi-Lin and Lee Yang of Taiwan, the reigning champions from the 2021 Tokyo Olympics, won a three-game thriller against China's Liang Weikeng and Wang Chang.

title: Showman Noah Lyles wins 100m gold by five thousandths of a second

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Noah Lyles won the closest-ever Olympic 100m final by five-thousandths of a second on Sunday (Aug 4) to give the United States the title for the first time in 20 years.
  • In a blanket finish Lyles believed he had left it too late to catch the powerful Kishane Thompson, but the giant screen confirmed him as the winner in a personal best 9.79s, the same time as the Jamaican, but ahead by the width of a vest.

title: Italy's Errani and Paolini win women's doubles gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Sara Errani and Jasmine Paolini claimed Italy's first-ever Olympic tennis gold medal as they beat Mirra Andreeva and Diana Shnaider 2-6 6-1 (10-7) to win the women's doubles on Sunday (Aug 4).
  • Errani, the 37-year-old former doubles world number one, became the seventh player to complete the career Golden Slam in women's doubles having won all four majors and the Olympic title.
  • It was Italy's first-ever gold medal in an Olympic tennis event, a day after compatriot Lorenzo Musetti defeated Felix Auger-Aliassime to win bronze in the men's singles.

#attributes.alt: Italy's Errani and Paolini win women's doubles gold
#attributes.title: Italy's Errani and Paolini win women's doubles gold

title: Badminton-Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik win Malaysia's first medals in Paris

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Malaysia's Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik bagged bronze on Sunday (Aug 4) after winning 16-21 22-20 21-19 against Kim Astrup and Anders Rasmussen of Denmark in a match that lasted over an hour, destroyed 34 shuttlecocks and was filled with hypnotic rallies.
  • Taiwan's Lee Yang and Wang Chi-Lin retained their Olympic badminton men's doubles title, beating China's Liang Weikeng and Wang Chang 21-17 18-21 21-19 at the Porte de La Chapelle arena in a gripping final.
  • Earlier in the day, Rio gold medallist Carolina Marin of Spain's Olympic run ended in heartbreaking fashion when she was forced to retire midway through her women's singles semi-final against China's He Bingjiao, with what appeared to be a serious knee injury.

#attributes.alt: Badminton-Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik win Malaysia's first medals in Paris
#attributes.title: Badminton-Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik win Malaysia's first medals in Paris

description: There are up to 16 fleet races in the opening series for kite-foilers, before the medals are contested on Thursday.

  • Maeder finished fifth position in his first race, topped the second, took second in the third race and did not finish the fourth.

title: Gymnastics-Yulo wins men's vault to scoop second gold in Paris

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Carlos Edriel Yulo of the Philippines won his second gold medal in as many days after he soared to the top of the podium in the men's vault at the Paris Olympics on Sunday (Aug 4).
  • Twenty-four hours after Yulo became the first Filipino to capture an Olympic gymnastics title with victory in the floor exercise final, he doubled his Olympic gold medal haul by eclipsing Artur Davtyan.
  • Yulo nailed his opening Dragulescu vault in the tuck position, taking just a small step backwards and was rewarded by the judges with a huge score of 15.433 points.

#attributes.alt: Gymnastics-Yulo wins men's vault to scoop second gold in Paris
#attributes.title: Gymnastics-Yulo wins men's vault to scoop second gold in Paris

title: Djokovic fights off Alcaraz to finally strike gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Novak Djokovic completed his career Golden Slam as the 37-year-old Serb fought off Spain's Carlos Alcaraz in a magnificent Olympic men's singles final battle at Roland Garros on Sunday (Aug 4).
  • Top seed Djokovic delivered one of the finest performances of his career to deny a man 16 years his junior and become only the fifth player to win all four singles Grand Slams and the Olympic title during a career.
  • Djokovic had lost three times in Olympic singles semi-finals and knew arriving in Paris that this was his last realistic chance to fill the last remaining space in a trophy cabinet that contains a men's record 24 Grand Slam titles.

#attributes.alt: Djokovic fights off Alcaraz to finally strike gold
#attributes.title: Djokovic fights off Alcaraz to finally strike gold

title: ‘It means everything’: What it’s like being your country’s only competitor at the Olympics
description: Four athletes at the Paris Olympics are their nations’ only representatives. These athletes hail from Belize, Liechtenstein, Nauru and Somalia.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Nauru’s Winzar Kakiouea and Belize’s Shaun Gill are the only representatives from their nations at the Paris Olympics.
  • “It means everything,” said Kakiouea, when asked about how it feels to be his country’s lone representative.
  • “You feel like you have the entire country on your back,” said Gill, who told CNA he would be retiring after the Games.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Ledecky wins record-equalling ninth gold medal

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Already rated one of swimming's all-time greats coming into the Paris Olympics, Katie Ledecky made it official on Saturday (Aug 3) by storming to victory in her signature event, the 800-metre freestyle to end her work in the French capital in great style.
  • But it is Ledecky writing her name in the record books after she claimed her ninth gold, equalling Russian gymnast Larisa Latynina for the most by any woman in any Olympic sport.
  • The 800m was the final event on Ledecky's Paris card and she returns home having added two golds, a silver and a bronze, bringing her Olympic stockpile to 14 medals in all - with more possible.

#attributes.alt: Ledecky wins record-equalling ninth gold medal
#attributes.title: Ledecky wins record-equalling ninth gold medal

title: McIntosh makes Canadian history with third gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Canada's Summer McIntosh won the women's 200-metre individual medley on Saturday in an Olympic record time for her third swimming gold of the Paris Games and fourth medal overall.
  • Kate Douglass of the United States won the silver and Australian Kaylee McKeown the bronze after U.S. swimmer Alex Walsh was disqualified.
  • The gold completed a medley double for the 17-year-old McIntosh, who won the 400 IM last Monday, also won the 200 butterfly on Thursday and took silver in the 400 freestyle on the opening Saturday.

#attributes.alt: McIntosh makes Canadian history with third gold
#attributes.title: McIntosh makes Canadian history with third gold

title: Milak roars home for men's 100 metres butterfly gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Hungarian powerhouse Kristof Milak stormed to a second Olympic gold with victory in a thrilling men's 100 metres butterfly final on Saturday, while adding to the silver medal he won in the 200m event at the Paris Games.
  • Milak had to do it the hard way, coming back from fourth at the turn, emerging clear from a maelstrom of thrashing arms to draw level with Canadian runner-up Josh Liendo in the final metres before edging him by a fingertip.

title: Gymnastics-Biles soars to third gold medal of Paris Olympics with vault triumph

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Simone Biles won the vault final on Saturday to clinch her third gold medal at the Paris Olympics, dominating the competition with her signature Biles II vault to beat Brazilian silver medallist Rebeca Andrade with American Jade Carey taking bronze.
  • Biles arrived in Paris as the world's most decorated gymnast and she has reached new heights by claiming gold medals in all three women's events contested so far in Paris.
  • Biles' impact is not only confined to gymnastics as she also sparked a conversation about mental health after pulling out of the Tokyo Games in the middle of the team final three years ago.

title: Swimming: Singapore women's 4x100m medley squad finish 14th at Paris Olympics
description: The quartet of Levenia Sim, Letitia Sim, Quah Jing Wen and Gan Ching Hwee clocked a time of 4:05.58, and did not move on to the event's final.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• At the La Defense Arena on Saturday (Aug 3), Levenia Sim, Letitia Sim, Quah Jing Wen and Gan Ching Hwee combined to clock a time of 4:05.58 and finish seventh in their 4x100m medley relay heat, and 14th overall.
  • This was the first time a swimming relay team had qualified to represent Singapore at the Olympics on merit.
  • Some noise had surrounded the build-up to the Games for the relay team following a selection saga which saw Gan replace Quah Ting Wen.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Singapore's Marc Brian Louis withdraws from Paris Olympics 100m with injury after progressing through prelims

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore sprinter Marc Brian Louis withdrew from the first round of the men's 100m at the Paris Olympics on Saturday (Aug 3) after picking up an injury.

  • He had earlier qualified for the first round proper after progressing through the preliminary round of the event.

  • A spokesperson for the Singapore National Olympic Council told CNA: "Marc decided to withdraw from the heats as he felt a discomfort in his hamstring after the prelims, so as to prevent incurring a significant injury."

title: 'I was hoping to put on a better show': Disappointment but not despair for Loh Kean Yew after Olympics exit
description: Loh's Paris Olympics campaign ended on Friday, after he was beaten by reigning men’s singles champion Viktor Axelsen in the quarter-finals.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• At the Porte de La Chapelle Arena, world number 2 Axelsen beat Singapore's world number 12 Loh Kean Yew 21-9, 21-17.
  • "I gave my all, I tried my best and I put everything on the court, but it wasn't enough,” said Loh.
  • Apart from an opponent in imperious form, Loh had to deal with a scrapped right hand which was taped up to stem the bleeding and affected his grip

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Commentary: Can the Olympics attract Gen Z eyeballs while preserving its traditions?
description: The International Olympic Committee continues to add new sports to attract younger viewers. Will it work or could there be unintended consequences? These sports lecturers from Deakin University weigh in.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Olympics has been the world’s premier sporting event for more than a century.
  • The most significant challenge for the Olympics today arguably is maintaining its appeal to modern audiences, particularly Generation Z, say sports lecturers from Deakin University.
  • While the integration of unconventional Olympic events may attract younger viewers, it may also risk disillusioning older, existing audiences.

author: Joshua McLeod

#attributes.alt: Commentary: Can the Olympics attract Gen Z eyeballs while preserving its traditions?

title: Magical Marchand takes fourth gold in Paris pool

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Leon Marchand fulfilled what French fans may regard as destiny as he swept to a fourth gold medal at his home Paris Games by winning the men's 200 metres Individual Medley in an Olympic record time on Friday.
  • The win made Marchand the first French athlete to take four individual golds, as opposed to team ones, at a single Summer Games and only the third male swimmer to do so after Americans Michael Phelps and Mark Spitz.
  • The 22-year-old won the 400 Individual Medley last Sunday and then both the 200 butterfly and 200 breaststroke within the space of two incredible hours on Wednesday.

title: Singapore sprint queen Shanti Pereira misses out on 100m semis spot at Paris Olympics
description: Pereira finished 55th out of 72 athletes overall in the heats with a time of 11.63s.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore sprint queen Shanti Pereira missed out on a 100m semi-final spot at the Paris Olympics after she finished 55th out of 72 athletes in the heats on Fri (Aug 2).
  • At the Stade de France, Pereira clocked a time of 11.63s to finish 7th out of nine runners in her heat.
  • She had suffered an injury setback earlier in the year, where a stress injury in her fibula put paid to her Olympics preparation as well as plans to compete in the Diamond League and various meets.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Singapore sprint queen Shanti Pereira misses out on 100m semis spot at Paris Olympics
#attributes.title: Singapore sprint queen Shanti Pereira misses out on 100m semis spot at Paris Olympics

title: Highs and lows: Loh Kean Yew’s road to the Paris Olympics badminton quarter-finals
description: CNA traces Loh's path from his beginnings as a Singapore Sports School student to Olympics quarter-finalist.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Loh Kean Yew was 13 when he arrived in Singapore from Penang in 2010 after receiving a scholarship from the Singapore Sports School to study and train as a student-athlete.
  • In December 2021, Loh sealed his place in the history books by becoming the first Singaporean to win a BWF World Championships title.
  • In Paris, Loh upset China's world No 6 Li Shifeng to set up a quarter-final clash with Denmark's world No 2 Viktor Axelsen.

author: Firdaus Hamzah

#attributes.alt: Highs and lows: Loh Kean Yew’s road to the Paris Olympics badminton quarter-finals
#attributes.title: Highs and lows: Loh Kean Yew’s road to the Paris Olympics badminton quarter-finals

title: Simone Biles clinches sixth Olympic gold at all-around gymnastics final

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Simone Biles clinched her sixth Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, reasserting her status as the number one all-around gymnast three years after she withdrew from the same final at the Tokyo Games.
  • Biles, the most decorated gymnast of all time, withdrew from the event in Tokyo to prioritise her mental health after suffering from the "twisties".

title: 'Job's not done': Loh Kean Yew ready to play underdog role against reigning Olympic champ Axelsen in quarters
description: On Thursday, the Singaporean triumphed 23-21, 21-15 over China's world number six Li Shi Feng to book his place in the men's singles quarters at the Paris Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore's Loh Kean Yew marched on to the quarter-finals of the men's singles competition of the Paris Olympics on Thursday (Aug 1).
  • He beat China's Li Shifeng 23-21, 21-15 and will next face reigning Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen.
  • The pressure is on Axelsen, said Loh, who has typically thrived in the role of underdog.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Badminton: Singapore's Loh Kean Yew upsets world number 6 Li, advances to Paris Olympics quarters
description: The win means the 27-year-old will at least equal the best finish by a Singaporean badminton player at the Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore's Loh Kean Yew moved one step closer to Olympic success after he upset China's world number six Li Shifeng on Thursday (Aug 1).
  • At the Porte de La Chapelle Arena, the world number 12 took the men's singles match 23-21, 21-15 to set up a tantalising quarter-final clash with Denmark's Viktor Axelsen.
  • Loh is the first Singaporean to reach the quarter-finals at the Olympics in two decades.

title: Olympic champion Pan Zhanle's 100m freestyle record should not be questioned, says Proud

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• China's Pan Zhanle has no questions to answer about his sensational 100m freestyle swimming world record at the Paris Olympics, British sprint specialist Ben Proud said on Thursday (Aug 1).
  • Pan smashed his own record with a time of 46.40s in the last race of the night at the La Defense Arena on Wednesday.
  • The Chinese swim team has been in the spotlight since revelations in April that 23 of its athletes competed at the 2021 Olympics despite testing positive for a banned heart medication.

title: China's Pan wins 'magic' 100m freestyle gold in new world record
description: Pan's victory was a much-needed boost for China who have disappointed in the Paris pool so far.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• China's Pan Zhanle enjoyed a "magic moment" after smashing his own world record on his way to victory in the men's 100m freestyle at the Paris Olympics on Wednesday (Jul 31).
  • Pan powered to the finish in 46.40s, beating the world record time of 46.80s he had set in February in Doha.

title: Badminton: Loh Kean Yew books spot in knockout stages at Paris Olympics, will face China's world number 6 Li
description: Loh beat El Salvador's Uriel Canjura 21-13, 21-16.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Loh Kean Yew booked his spot in the men's singles knockout rounds after beating El Salvador's Uriel Canjura on Wednesday (Jul 31).
  • The win meant Loh topped his qualification group, after beating Czech Republic's Jan Louda on Sunday.
  • Loh will next face China's world number 6 Li Shifeng on Thursday.

title: Table tennis: Singapore's Zeng Jian eliminated from Paris Olympics by India's Sreeja Akula

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore's world No 52 Zeng Jian was eliminated from the Paris Olympics in the women's singles round of 32 after losing to India's Sreeja Akula on Wednesday (Jul 31).
  • The 27-year-old was Singapore's only table tennis representative left at the Games.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: China's table tennis champ Wang Chuqin suffers shock singles exit at Paris Olympics

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• China's table tennis world number one Wang Chuqin suffered a shock defeat in the men's Olympic singles.
  • Wang won mixed doubles gold on Tuesday in Paris but his elation quickly turned to anger after a photographer accidentally snapped his bat while jostling to take a picture.
  • Less than 24 hours later, Wang went out in the round of 32 of the singles after a 4-2 defeat to Truls Moregard of Sweden.

title: Triathlon: Beaugrand storms home to take gold for France

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• France's Cassandre Beaugrand won gold in the women's triathlon at the Paris Olympics, cheered on by a delighted crowd as the hosts' gamble to hold the swim stage of the race in the Seine paid off after days of uncertainty.
  • The men's triathlon had been scheduled to take place on Tuesday but, after the river failed water quality tests, it was postponed to 10.45am on Wednesday, immediately after the women's race.
  • "We have achieved in four years what has been impossible for a century: the Seine is swimmable," President Emmanuel Macron tweeted after the race.
