title: Badminton: Yeo Jia Min progresses to knockout stages at Paris Olympics, first Singaporean to do so since 2012
description: Yeo beat Mauritius' Kate Foo Kune on Tuesday (Jul 30) to top her group and progress to the last 16.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• World number 20 Yeo Jia Min dispatched Mauritius' world ranked 93rd Kate Foo Kune 21-12, 21-6 in just 26 minutes on Tuesday (Jul 26).
  • The win, the 25-year-old's second at the Paris Olympics, meant that she topped her group and progressed to the next round of the competition.
  • Yeo is the first Singaporean badminton player to reach the knockout stages at the Olympic Games in more than a decade.

title: 'It is just passion': 40 years after Ang Peng Siong’s Olympics debut, his brother fulfils his own Games dream
description: An ex-national swimmer who once dreamed of competing at the Olympics, Ang Peng Wee finally got his chance to be involved at the Games, as a technical official.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• An ex-national swimmer who once dreamed of competing at the Olympics, Ang Peng Wee is now a swimming technical official at the Paris Games.
  • “To fulfil the dream of (being an) Olympian as an athlete, it didn’t materialise. So the next dream is to officiate and be at the Olympics," Peng Wee told CNA.
  • His brother Ang Peng Siong made his Games debut at the Los Angeles Games 40 years ago.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Singapore swimmer Gan Ching Hwee sets new 1,500m free national record at Olympics, just misses out on final

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Debutant Gan Ching Hwee sets new national record at Olympics in 1,500m freestyle on Tuesday (Jul 30).
  • The national record was the first set by a female Olympian swimmer at the Games since 2012.
  • Gan narrowly missed out on a spot in the final after she finished ninth overall. She will be first reserve.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: I almost lost faith, says Japan's Hashimoto after snatching gymnastics team gold

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Japanese gymnast Daiki Hashimoto recovered from an early stumble to help secure the gymnastics team gold at the Paris Olympics, with China settling for silver. 
  • Still nursing a finger injury, Hashimoto said that his teammates' unwavering determination and constant encouragement that carried him through the difficult moments.

title: Egyptian fencer Hafez carrying a 'little Olympian' as she reveals pregnancy at Paris Games

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Egyptian fencer Nada Hafez had double reason to celebrate after picking up her first victory at an Olympics in the women's sabre event on Monday (Jul 29) as she revealed that she did so while seven months pregnant.
  • "What appears to you as two players on the podium, they were actually three! It was me, my competitor, & my yet-to-come to our world, little baby!" Hafez wrote on Instagram.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Spain's Rafa Nadal made a triumphant return to Roland Garros on Sunday (Jul 28) to blast his way into the second round of the Olympic tennis tournament, and set up a blockbuster clash with nemesis Novak Djokovic of Serbia.
  • In the women’s draw, US team flagbearer Coco Gauff dazzled under the fading sun to sweep aside Australia's Ajla Tomljanovic 6-3 6-0 in double-quick time, while Chinese sixth seed Qinwen Zheng had made a mockery of former French Open runner-up Sara Errani’s clay credentials, pummelling the Italian 6-0 6-0 to advance.

title: An Olympic dream at 58: Table tennis player Zeng Zhiying's Paris debut captivates despite loss
description: More than three decades after she moved on from table tennis, Zeng Zhiying fulfilled her dream of making it to the Olympics, albeit representing a different nation.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Born in Guangzhou in 1966, Zeng Zhiying had hopes of one day representing China at the Olympics, but a change of rules in the game led to her retiring from table tennis at the age of 20.
  • Playing table tennis as a professional had only crossed her mind during the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • But after picking up the sport in earnest once again, Zeng - as the Chileans call her - in 2023 qualified for the Paris Olympics.
  • Asked if she will aim for a return to the Olympics in four years in Los Angeles, Zeng's answer is yes.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Fencing: Singapore’s Kiria Tikanah exits after loss to world No. 3 opponent at Paris Olympics
description: Earlier in the day, Kiria had edged out a Peruvian opponent ranked almost 30 places higher in the world rankings.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Singapore epee fencer Kiria Tikanah suffered a 10-15 loss to Italy’s world number 3 Alberta Santuccio in the table of 32 at the Paris Olympics on Saturday (Jul 27).
  • She had earlier edged out Peru’s Maria Calderon 15-14 at the Grand Palais.
  • This is Kiria’s second Games appearance after making her debut at the Tokyo Olympics three years ago.
  • Her compatriot Amita Berthier will begin her Games campaign in round of 32 against United States’ Lauren Scruggs on Sunday.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Fencing: Singapore’s Kiria Tikanah exits after loss to world No. 3 opponent at Paris Olympics
#attributes.title: Fencing: Singapore’s Kiria Tikanah exits after loss to world No. 3 opponent at Paris Olympics

title: Mixed fortunes for Singapore’s badminton players as they begin Paris Olympics campaign
description: Yeo Jia Min enjoyed a winning start to her Olympic Games campaign, while the mixed doubles pair of Terry Hee and Jessica Tan suffered a debut defeat.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• At the Porte de La Chapelle Arena, world number 20 and 13th seed Yeo Jia Min dispatched Refugee Olympic team’s Dorsa Yavarivafa 21-7, 21-8 in 22 minutes.
  • This means that a win against Mauritius Kate Foo Kune in her next match will see her progress to the round of 16.
  • Olympic debutants Terry Hee and Jessica Tan lost to Malaysia’s world number 9 duo of Chen Tang Jie and Toh Ee Wei 21-23, 12-21. 
  • They will now need to beat the world number 2 pair of Feng Yanzhe and Huang Dongping on Sunday to stand any chance of progressing.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Mixed fortunes for Singapore’s badminton players as they begin Paris Olympics campaign
#attributes.title: Mixed fortunes for Singapore’s badminton players as they begin Paris Olympics campaign

title: Rain-soaked Seine spectacle marks Paris Olympics opening; Singapore led by flagbearers Shanti Pereira, Ryan Lo

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Paris Olympics was officially declared open by French President Emmanuel Macron on a rain-soaked Friday evening.
  • On an 85-boat parade down a 6km stretch of the Seine, Team Singapore's contingent of 29 athletes and officials was led by flagbearers Shanti Pereira and Ryan Lo.
  • "(It) feels like a dream!" said sprint queen Pereira, who will be competing in the 100m and 200m events.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Before going pro Down Under, Danelle Tan offers inside look at her life in German football
description: This 19-year-old Singaporean made history playing for Borussia Dortmund. The programme On The Red Dot joined her at the club before she traded lower-league European football for a professional contract in Australia’s top women’s division.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Danelle Tan may have made history in Borussia Dortmund, but she was not paid, let alone making a living playing football.
  • That is about to change, following her decision to play professionally in Australia’s top women’s division.
  • Her time in Dortmund, including her skills training in its famous Footbonaut pioneered by Jurgen Klopp, has helped.

author: Derrick A Paulo

#attributes.alt: Before going pro Down Under, Danelle Tan offers inside look at her life in German football
#attributes.title: Before going pro Down Under, Danelle Tan offers inside look at her life in German football

title: Commentary: Olympics host cities don’t belong on a warming planet
description: The only way to make the Games more sustainable is to spread them out and shrink them, says David Fickling for Bloomberg Opinion.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The ideal that animates the Olympic Games - that they belong in a single city to which athletes from across the world make pilgrimage - is looking increasingly threadbare, says David Fickling for Bloomberg Opinion.
  • If future events limited athlete numbers to 5,000, the cost, both to the climate and to city budgets, would be drastically reduced.

author: David Fickling

#attributes.alt: Commentary: Olympics host cities don’t belong on a warming planet
#attributes.title: Commentary: Olympics host cities don’t belong on a warming planet

title: Indonesia aims for gold in weightlifting at Paris Olympics
description: Members of the team include Rizki Juniansyah, gold medallist at this year’s weightlifting world cup.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• After winning seven silvers and eight bronzes in weightlifting at the Olympic Games, Indonesia is aiming for that elusive first gold.
  • The country's hopes are pinned on the team, including gold medallist at this year’s weightlifting world cup Rizki Juniansyah.
  • The only woman in the team is Nurul Akmal, who hopes that more women will be able to represent Indonesia in the sport and qualify for the Olympics in future editions.

author: Chandni Vatvani

title: Singapore investigates basketball coach for allegedly taking bribes to put children in top schools
description: He is no longer working in any MOE school, and his coaching membership has been suspended by SportSG.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• A basketball coach is being investigated for allegedly accepting improper payments from parents to get their children into secondary schools through the Direct School Admission (DSA) scheme.
  • The coach allegedly charged parents S$45,000 to S$50,000 to ensure their children enter several schools of their choice.
  • The Ministry of Education and Sport Singapore both confirmed that the coach is currently under investigation, with the individual de-registered since April and no longer working in any MOE school.

author: Justin Ong Guang-Xi

description: CNA's Matthew Mohan has a finger on the pulse as Paris 2024 is set to get underway.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Paris Olympics will officially open on Friday (Jul 26), with an opening ceremony like no other to kick off the sporting extravaganza.
  • But there are mixed feelings for many, as the Games has resulted in snarling traffic, road blockages and inconveniences
  • At the same time, there is a sense of excitement in the air for athletes and locals alike.

title: Team Singapore at the Paris Olympics: Five athletes to look out for
description: Three years after the last Games, Singapore's finest will be back in action at the world's biggest sporting meet.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The Paris Olympics will run from Jul 26 to Aug 11.
  • The last time Singapore took home an Olympics medal was eight years ago, when swimmer Joseph Schooling stunned the world to win gold in the 100m butterfly.
  • Arguably Singapore's best bet for a medal at this edition is 17-year-old world champion kitefoiler Maximilian Maeder, who has been on a scintillating run of form.

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Singapore must prioritise growing own football youth pipeline over importing foreign talent: Edwin Tong
description: The Minister for Culture, Community and Youth tells CNA the "focus is really on building up the Singapore core".

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• The most "sustainable" way for Singapore football to grow is by building a pool of its own youth players rather than just importing foreign talent, said Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong.
  • The goal is to build a Singapore team that is "Singaporean by culture and Singaporean in identity",  Mr Tong said.
  • He was speaking with other panellists as part of a TV special by CNA programme Talking Point, titled Singapore Football: Can We Make It Great (Again)?

author: Matthew Mohan

title: Paris 2024 athletes, families, coaches invited to attend parliament sitting

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Team Singapore athletes who participated in the Paris Olympics and Paralympics, including medallists Jeralyn Tan, Maximilian Maeder and Yip Pin Xiu, have been invited to attend a sitting of parliament next month.
  • In a Facebook post on Monday (Sep 23), Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong said that his ministry will propose a motion at the sitting to congratulate all the athletes, especially the medallists, for their achievements at the Games.

author: Daphne Yow

title: In pictures: Action from the 2024 Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Motorsport fans descended over the weekend onto the Marina Bay Street Circuit, one of the toughest tracks that Formula 1 drivers will face over the course of a season.

  • McLaren's Lando Norris kept his lead from start to end to win the Singapore Grand Prix on Sunday (Sep 22), reducing Max Verstappen's F1 championship lead in the process. Red Bull's Verstappen finished second, between Norris and his teammate Oscar Piastri.

  • Here's a look back at all the weekend's twists and turns through the lenses of two of CNA's visual journalists.

author: Wallace Woon

#attributes.alt: In pictures: Action from the 2024 Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix
#attributes.title: In pictures: Action from the 2024 Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix

title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins Singapore Grand Prix to narrow F1 title race

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• McLaren's Lando Norris dominated the Singapore Grand Prix from start to finish on Sunday (Sep 22) to take another chunk out of Max Verstappen's Formula 1 championship lead. 
  • Verstappen finished second for Red Bull, a massive 20.945 seconds behind his main rival, and McLaren's Oscar Piastri was third in a sweltering night race run over 62 laps in exhausting heat and humidity.
  • It was a remarkably incident-free run around the Marina Bay Street Circuit, the first in its 15-race history not to see a safety car deployed.

#attributes.alt: McLaren's Lando Norris wins Singapore Grand Prix to narrow F1 title race
#attributes.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins Singapore Grand Prix to narrow F1 title race

title: Singapore's Max Maeder wins Asian kitefoiling title in China
description: This is Maeder’s second title in as many competitions since the Paris Olympics.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Olympic medallist Max Maeder won the 2024 Formula Kite Asian Championships in Daishan, China on Sunday (Sep 22), his second title in as many competitions since the Paris Games.
  • Earlier in the week, Maeder won eight of the 12 races in the opening series, which was cut short due to a typhoon hitting the region prior to the competition.
  • Winds were too strong for racing on Sunday said the International Kiteboarding Association on Instagram. This meant that the medal series would not be contested and the Singaporean took the title. Maeder finished second in the last edition of the competition in 2023.

author: Matthew Mohan

#attributes.alt: Singapore's Max Maeder wins Asian kitefoiling title in China
#attributes.title: Singapore's Max Maeder wins Asian kitefoiling title in China

title: Norris pips Verstappen to dramatic Singapore Grand Prix pole after Sainz crash

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• McLaren's Lando Norris beat Red Bull's Max Verstappen to pole position on Saturday (Sep 21) for the Singapore Grand Prix in a dramatic qualifying session.
  • It was a disastrous qualifying session for Ferrari pair Charles Leclerc and Carlos Sainz, the winner in Singapore 12 months ago, who will start down in ninth and 10th on the grid.
  • Sainz's back end snapped out on the final bend sending him spinning into the barriers and halting Q3 with just over eight minutes remaining, leaving most drivers just one shot at a qualifying lap.

#attributes.alt: Norris pips Verstappen to dramatic Singapore Grand Prix pole after Sainz crash
#attributes.title: Norris pips Verstappen to dramatic Singapore Grand Prix pole after Sainz crash

title: Norris quickest as Verstappen bounces back in Singapore Grand Prix practice

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• McLaren's Lando Norris put together a scintillating lap of 1min 29.64sec around the Marina Bay Circuit, 0.479sec faster than George Russell's Mercedes.
  • Championship leader Max Verstappen was badly off the pace in Friday's opening two sessions but the three-time world champion saw overnight modifications to his Red Bull pay off with a lap of 1:30.540 for a much-improved fourth on the timesheets.
  • Singapore was the only race Red Bull did not win last year in a dominant season.

#attributes.alt: Norris quickest as Verstappen bounces back in Singapore Grand Prix practice

title: Singapore teen drivers Christian Ho, Kabir Anurag target F1 spots within 5 years
description: CNA caught up with the teenagers ahead of the Singapore Grand Prix night race to find out how they are juggling school work with racing, their F1 ambitions, and their upcoming national service.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Christian Ho and Kabir Anurag, both 17, are two of Singapore's brightest motor racing talents. They aim to race in Formula 1 within the next five years.
  • Christian recently made history by becoming the first Singaporean to secure a spot in Formula 3, while Kabir is the first local to join an F1 team's driver development programme.
  • CNA caught up with the teenagers ahead of the Singapore Grand Prix night race to find out how they are juggling school work with racing, their F1 ambitions, and their upcoming national service.

author: Aslam Shah

#attributes.alt: Singapore teen drivers Christian Ho, Kabir Anurag target F1 spots within 5 years
#attributes.title: Singapore teen drivers Christian Ho, Kabir Anurag target F1 spots within 5 years

title: Not just for drivers: Singaporeans explore F1 job opportunities off the track
description: From an internship with Red Bull Racing, to engineering jobs across Formula 1 teams, some Singaporeans have made their mark at the highest level in motorsport.

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• F1 is not just about the drivers – a host of other industries and job roles are involved, including engineering and communications.
  • One Singaporean is an engineer with Williams Racing – and he can work from home. His job helps determine if cars can go faster by altering their shape and structure.
  • He says: “There is a lot of technology transfer from F1 to healthcare, biomedical and automotive. If you're interested in technology, there's a ton of exposure that F1 gives you.”

author: Aslam Shah

#attributes.alt: Not just for drivers: Singaporeans explore F1 job opportunities off the track
#attributes.title: Not just for drivers: Singaporeans explore F1 job opportunities off the track

title: Shohei Ohtani makes baseball history with first 50-homer, 50-steal season

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani made Major League Baseball history on Thursday (Sep 20), becoming the first player ever to record 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season.
  • Ohtani officially established MLB's 50-50 club with a seventh-inning homer in the Dodgers' 20-4 victory over the Marlins in Miami.

title: Lewis Hamilton: 'Racial element' to FIA boss' 'rapper' comment

fast.tldr_for_shorts:
• Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton understands Formula 1's goal of cleaning up salty language on team radios, although Hamilton takes offence with how the situation has been portrayed, ESPN reported Thursday (Sep 19).
  • "With what he's saying, I don't like how he's expressed it, saying that rappers is very stereotypical," said Hamilton, a native of England who is Black.
  • Hamilton currently is in sixth place in the drivers' standings heading into this week's Singapore Grand Prix.
